channel.title: Using emote tabs to teleport people
channel.description:
Because of a very kind person I have changed the names from "Yes etc...To "Train" etc.. And now all i need to do is add teleport when they click on it it sends them to the place eg..
player clicks on the "Train" button and sends them to x 4586 y 5857
If you could help me I would be very very greatfull

item.title: Using emote tabs to teleport people
item.dc:creator: @Marc323909 Marc323909
item.description:
@Marc323909 wrote:

100 errors lamo im using Devalution 7.0 btw

Read full topic
item.source: Using emote tabs to teleport people

item.title: Using emote tabs to teleport people
item.dc:creator: @0_Deni_0 0 Deni 0
item.description:
@0_Deni_0 wrote:

[quote=“Marc323909, post:4, topic:179033”]ill try…wait asec

EDIT searched for public void emoteYes() didnt find anything

EDIT searched for case 168 and added what u said still didnt work and got 3 errors[/quote]

sendQuest("@whi@train", 180);

case 168: emoteYes(); break;

public void emoteYes() // Train
{
if(!isWild()) {
tele(,); }
else if (isWild()) {
sendMessage(“You must not be in a wilderness area.”); }
}

if you have this code’s in ur client.java it should work…

Read full topic
item.source: Using emote tabs to teleport people

item.title: Using emote tabs to teleport people
item.dc:creator: @Le_Jitt Le Jitt
item.description:
@Le_Jitt wrote:

Correction:

Dependant on which source your using which I think your using hiyascape because I had the same problem search this:

public void emoteNo() // train

ON IT’S OWN!

Then edit the coords in there so:

public void emoteNo() // train
{
if(!isWild()) {
tele(2727,3712); } <------- CHANGE THAT TO THE COORDS YOU WANT
else if (isWild()) {
sendMessage(“You must not be in a wilderness area.”); }
}

Read full topic
